intro: Mayna, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, stinging hairs. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, shady environments. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, clustered in dense inflorescences. Mayna is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and the Americas.
